intro: Uvaria alba, commonly known as white uvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it has simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains small, hard seeds. Uvaria alba is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and pleasant scent.
